about.headline: Your Trusted San Antonio Plumbing & Drain Partner
about.story:
Omega Plumbing & Drain was founded with a simple mission: to provide San Antonio area homeowners and businesses with honest, professional plumbing and drain services they can trust. As a locally owned and operated company, we understand the unique plumbing challenges that Texas properties face, from hard water issues to aging infrastructure.

Our team of licensed, experienced professionals treats every job with the same care and attention we'd want for our own homes. We believe in doing the job right the first time, using quality materials, and standing behind our work with solid warranties.

What sets us apart is our expertise in drain systems, combined with our commitment to transparency. We provide upfront pricing, explain your options clearly, and never pressure you into unnecessary services. When you call Omega Plumbing & Drain, you're getting straight answers and skilled craftsmanship.

faq.question: Do you offer 24/7 emergency plumbing and drain services?
faq.answer: Yes! We provide 24/7 emergency plumbing and drain services throughout the San Antonio area. Whether it's a burst pipe at 2 AM or a major drain backup on a holiday, we're here to help. Call (210) 618-2887 anytime for immediate assistance.

faq.question: How often should I have my drains professionally cleaned?
faq.answer: Most homes benefit from professional drain cleaning every 18-24 months as preventive maintenance. However, if you have older pipes, large trees near your sewer line, or frequent slow drains, annual cleaning may be beneficial. Commercial properties often need quarterly maintenance.

faq.question: Do you provide upfront pricing?
faq.answer: Absolutely. We believe in transparent pricing with no hidden fees. After diagnosing your plumbing or drain issue, we'll provide a clear, detailed quote before starting any work. You'll know exactly what you're paying for, and we won't proceed without your approval.

faq.question: Are you licensed and insured?
faq.answer: Yes, Omega Plumbing & Drain is fully licensed by the State of Texas, bonded, and insured. All our technicians are licensed professionals who undergo regular training and background checks.

faq.question: What payment methods do you accept?
faq.answer: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, MasterCard, American Express, Discover), debit cards, checks, and cash. We also offer financing options for larger projects through approved credit partners.

faq.question: Do you offer warranties on your work?
faq.answer: Yes! We stand behind our work with a comprehensive warranty. Labor is covered, and parts are covered according to manufacturer warranties. Specific warranty terms are provided with each service.

faq.question: What are signs that I need professional drain cleaning?
faq.answer: Common signs include slow-draining sinks, gurgling sounds from drains, foul odors, water backing up in multiple fixtures, and repeated clogs. If you notice any of these signs, it's time to call for professional drain cleaning.

faq.question: How do I know if I need to replace or repair my water heater?
faq.answer: Generally, if your water heater is over 10-12 years old, making unusual noises, leaking, or not providing consistent hot water, replacement is often more cost-effective than repair. Our technicians will assess your specific situation and provide honest recommendations.

faq.question: What should I do if I have a major drain backup?
faq.answer: First, stop using all water in your home immediately. Then call us at (210) 618-2887 for emergency service. Avoid flushing toilets, running faucets, or using appliances that drain water. Our emergency team will arrive quickly to address the issue.

faq.question: Do you service commercial properties?
faq.answer: Yes, we provide comprehensive plumbing and drain services for commercial properties including offices, retail spaces, restaurants, and industrial facilities. We offer scheduled maintenance programs, after-hours service, and can handle projects of any size.

faq.question: What is hydro-jetting and when is it needed?
faq.answer: Hydro-jetting uses high-pressure water streams to thoroughly clean drain lines, removing grease, scale, and tree roots. It's recommended for severe clogs, recurring drain problems, and as preventive maintenance for commercial properties or homes with older plumbing.

faq.question: What areas do you serve?
faq.answer: We serve San Antonio and all surrounding communities including Alamo Heights, Olmos Park, Terrell Hills, Windcrest, Helotes, Leon Valley, and more. If you're in the San Antonio area, give us a call and we'll let you know if we can help.

faq.question: Can you detect leaks behind walls or under slabs?
faq.answer: Yes, we use advanced leak detection equipment including electronic sensors and thermal imaging to locate hidden leaks behind walls, under slabs, and in other hard-to-reach areas. This technology allows us to pinpoint leaks without unnecessary demolition.

faq.question: Do you offer preventive maintenance plans?
faq.answer: Yes! Our preventive maintenance plans include regular inspections, minor repairs, priority scheduling, and discounted rates on services. These plans help catch problems early, extend the life of your systems, and save you money on emergency repairs.

faq.question: What is trenchless sewer repair?
faq.answer: Trenchless sewer repair is a modern method that allows us to repair or replace your sewer line without extensive excavation of your yard. Using specialized equipment, we can often complete the work through small access points, minimizing disruption to your landscaping and property.
